Package Core

Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
Core.Sprite
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Sprite>
Direct Known Subclasses:
PhysicBody, Puntuacio, Roca, Vides
public class Sprite extends Object implements Serializable, Comparable<Sprite>

This class is the representation of a Sprite in a Pixel Field.

It measures as a rectangle, has collision functions. Every class in a Pixel Field must extend from this class
Version:
0.8
Author:

Marc Albareda

See Also:
  • Git Repository

      public String name
      the name of the sprite

    • x1

      public float x1
      The horizontal position in the field of the upper-left pixel in the sprite

    • y1

      public float y1
      The vertical position in the field of the upper-left pixel in the sprite

    • x2

      public float x2
      The horizontal position in the field of the bottom-right pixel in the sprite

    • y2

      public float y2
      The vertical position in the field of the bottom-right pixel in the sprite

    • angle

      public double angle
      The rotating angle in degrees

    • path

      public String path
      The path to the image to that Sprite

    • solid

      public boolean solid
      Specifies whether this Sprite is solid. Non-solid sprites will not collide.

    • unscrollable

      public boolean unscrollable
      Specifies whether this sprite is unscrollable. Unscrollables won't be scrolled ever. Used for HUD or fixed objects

    • text

      public boolean text
      Specifies whether this sprite is text. Text won't use an image path and will print the String specified as path.

    • font

      public Font font
      Font for the text if the Sprite is used as text

    • textColor

      public int textColor
      Color for the text if the Sprite is used as text

    • useImgArray

      public boolean useImgArray
      checks if an img Array should be used instead of a single image

    • imgArray

      public String[] imgArray
      array of images, needed if a single sprite has several images.

    • drawingBoxExtraLeft

      public int drawingBoxExtraLeft
      marks this Sprite to be deleted.

    • drawingBoxExtraRight

      public int drawingBoxExtraRight

    • drawingBoxExtraUp

      public int drawingBoxExtraUp

    • drawingBoxExtraDown

      public int drawingBoxExtraDown

    • visible

      public boolean visible

    • collisionBox

      public boolean collisionBox
      checks whether this sprite has a collision box distinct to its drawing box

    • delete

      public boolean delete
      marks this sprite to be deleted. Deleted sprites aren't drawn and they do not collide.

    • flippedX

      public boolean flippedX
      marks this sprite as one that is flipped. Physics works correctly tho

    • flippedY

      public boolean flippedY

    • palleteSwap

      public boolean palleteSwap
      marks this sprite as a sprite with a palleteSwap

    • swapList

      public ArrayList<Color> swapList
      List of the required swaps. The even numbers will be replaced by the inmediately after number

    • layer

      public int layer
      layer of the object. Objects can ignore certain layers and won't collide with them. Defaults to 0

    • ignoredLayers

      public HashSet<Integer> ignoredLayers
      set of the ignored layers. Objects can ignore certain layers and won't collide with them

    • colorSprite

      public boolean colorSprite
      determines if this sprite is a color Sprite. Color Sprites are just squares with one color

    • color

      public Color color
      color of a colored sprite, in RGB-Alpha format.

    • orderInLayer

      public Integer orderInLayer
      Determines the order in the field. The higher the value the more in front will be. The highest value will be on the forefront and the lowest on the background.

  • Constructor Details

    • Sprite

      public Sprite(String name, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, double angle, String path, Field f)
      Default sprite constructor, for sprites that are rotated from their original image
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the sprite, for identification purposes
      x1 - x position (horizontal) of the upper left corner
      y1 - y position (vertical) of the upper left corner
      x2 - x position (horizontal) of the lower right corner
      y2 - y position (vertical) of the lower right corner
      angle - angle (in degrees) of rotation of the sprite
      path - path to the image of that sprite, as a relative path

    • Sprite

      public Sprite(String name, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, double angle, String[] path, Field f)
      Default sprite constructor, for sprites with multiple images that are rotated from their original image
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the sprite, for identification purposes
      x1 - x position (horizontal) of the upper left corner
      y1 - y position (vertical) of the upper left corner
      x2 - x position (horizontal) of the lower right corner
      y2 - y position (vertical) of the lower right corner
      angle - angle (in degrees) of rotation of the sprite
      path - path to the array of images of that sprite, as a relative path

    • Sprite

      public Sprite(String name, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, double angle, Color color, Field f)
      Default sprite constructor, for sprites that are simple squares of a single color
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the sprite, for identification purposes
      x1 - x position (horizontal) of the upper left corner
      y1 - y position (vertical) of the upper left corner
      x2 - x position (horizontal) of the lower right corner
      y2 - y position (vertical) of the lower right corner
      angle - angle (in degrees) of rotation of the sprite
      color - color of that sprite.

  • Method Details

    • getField

      public Field getField()
      Returns the field
      Returns:
      the field

    • setField

      public void setField(Field f)
      Sets the field and adds this sprite to its spriteList
      Parameters:
      f - the field that should be the new Sprite Field

    • changeImage

      public void changeImage(String path)
      changes the image
      Parameters:
      path - of the new image

    • palleteSwap

      public void palleteSwap(int c1, int c2)
      Swaps the two colors
      Parameters:
      c1 - the color that will be swapped out
      c2 - the color that will be swapped in

    • collisionBox

      public void collisionBox(int x1, int x2, int y1, int y2)
      Defines this sprite as having a drawing box different from the collision box
      Parameters:
      x1 - extra width of the drawing box (left side)
      x2 - extra width of the drawing box (right side)
      y1 - extra height of the drawing box (upper side)
      y2 - extra height of the drawing box (lower side)

    • removeCollisionBox

      public void removeCollisionBox()
      removes the collision box

    • collidesWithList

      public ArrayList<Sprite> collidesWithList(ArrayList<? extends Sprite> others)
      Returns the all the Sprites in the provided list that collide with this Sprite
      Parameters:
      others - A list of Sprites or classes that extends Sprite
      Returns:
      A list with all the sprites in the sprites list in the List that collides.
      Returns an Empty list if there is no collision with any Sprite

    • collidesWith

      public boolean collidesWith(Sprite other)
      Checks if this sprite collides with the provided sprite. It won't collide with itself, against non-solid sprites, or sprites marked as deleted
      Parameters:
      other - The other sprite

    • collidesWithPercent

      public double collidesWithPercent(Sprite other)
      Checks if this sprite collides with the provided sprite. It won't collide against non-solid sprites, or sprites marked as deleted
      Parameters:
      other - The other sprite

    • collidesWithPoint

      public boolean collidesWithPoint(int x, int y)
      Checks if this sprite collides with the point in coordinates x,y *
      Parameters:
      other - The other sprite

    • firstCollidesWithField

      public Sprite firstCollidesWithField()
      Returns the first Sprite in the provided filed that collides with this Sprite
      Parameters:
      f - A Pixel Field
      Returns:
      The first Sprite in the sprites list in the Pixel Field that collides.
      The Pixel Field is ordered by insertion in the code
      Returns null if there is no collision with any Sprite

    • collidesWithField

      public ArrayList<Sprite> collidesWithField()
      Returns the all the Sprites in the provided filed that collide with this Sprite
      Parameters:
      f - A Pixel Field
      Returns:
      A list with all the sprites in the sprites list in the Pixel Field that collides.
      The Pixel Field is ordered by insertion in the code
      Returns an Empty list if there is no collision with any Sprite

    • collidesWithField

      public ArrayList<Sprite> collidesWithField(Field f)
      Returns the all the Sprites in the provided filed that collide with this Sprite
      Parameters:
      f - A Pixel Field
      Returns:
      A list with all the sprites in the sprites list in the Pixel Field that collides.
      The Pixel Field is ordered by insertion in the code
      Returns an Empty list if there is no collision with any Sprite

    • firstCollidesWithList

      public Sprite firstCollidesWithList(ArrayList<? extends Sprite> others)
      Returns the first Sprite in the provided list that collides with this Sprite
      Parameters:
      others - A list of Sprites or classes that extends Sprite
      Returns:
      The first Sprite in the llist that collides
      Returns null if there is no collision with any Sprite

    • delete

      public void delete()
      marks this sprite to be deleted. Sprites marked for deletion won't collide or be drawn.

    • undelete

      public void undelete()

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • update

      public void update()
      each turn the update function will be called for every non-deleted sprite in a field.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Sprite other)
      CompareTo orders the list according to the orderInLayer. This ensures that the higher sprites are drawn last
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Sprite>

      public int getCurrentImg()

    • setCurrentImg
